title: Restore heartbeat endpoint lost in beadhub refactoring
description:
POST /v1/workspaces/heartbeat was dropped when beadhub was refactored from beadhub-main. The presence.py module and its tests survived intact, and routes that call into presence (register, mcp, status, agent listing) still work. But the heartbeat endpoint itself (~249 lines in beadhub-main workspaces.py lines 518-766) is missing.

The heartbeat endpoint is what the bdh CLI calls to refresh workspace presence. Without it, presence data goes stale and is never refreshed.

Reference implementation: beadhub-main/src/beadhub/routes/workspaces.py (search for 'heartbeat').
Refactored codebase missing it: beadhub/src/beadhub/routes/workspaces.py.

Steps the endpoint performs:
1. Extract project_id from auth
2. Pre-check workspace immutability (project_id + alias match)
3. Resolve/create repo record (normalize git origin)
4. Upsert workspace record in SQL (immutability constraints, alias collision check via DB + Redis)
5. Update presence in Redis (best-effort) — hash + secondary indexes
6. Cloud-only: track usage (non-blocking)
7. Return OK

Philosophy: presence is a cache of SQL. SQL authoritative, Redis ephemeral.

Note: only restore the beadhub-specific heartbeat. We discussed with Juan whether presence should live in aweb — conclusion is that workspace-level presence is beadhub-specific (repos, branches, workspace paths). Generic agent-level presence for aweb is a separate future concern.
close_reason: Created in wrong beads database (aweb instead of beadhub). Grace will create the issue in beadhub's beads.

title: Epic: Agent-level presence and heartbeat for aweb
description:
aweb needs agent-level presence so that:
- aw list-agents returns accurate online status (currently always offline)
- Chat/mail senders can check recipient availability
- beadhub's workspace heartbeat can sync to aweb's agent presence

Architecture: Redis-backed presence with TTL at the agent_id level. Simpler than beadhub's workspace presence (no repos, branches, workspace paths). beadhub's workspace heartbeat should also update aweb's agent presence as a side-effect.

Includes aweb server changes and aw Go client changes. beadhub integration tracked separately in beadhub's beads.

title: Add GET /v1/agents endpoint
description:
aweb has no agent listing endpoint. The aw Go client (agents.go) calls GET /v1/agents and expects a ListAgentsResponse with project_id and a list of AgentView (agent_id, alias, human_name, agent_type, status, last_seen, online).

The endpoint should:
- Require auth (Bearer API key)
- Scope to the authenticated project_id
- Query the agents table for all non-deleted agents in the project
- Return the list matching the AgentView shape from aw/agents.go

This is needed independently of presence — even without online status, users need to list agents in their project.

Note: the online/last_seen fields will be empty until presence is implemented (aweb-gkv children).

title: Add agent presence module (Redis)
description:
Create src/aweb/presence.py — a Redis-backed agent presence module. Simpler than beadhub's workspace presence (no repos, branches, workspace paths).

Redis data structures:
- presence:agent:{agent_id} → Hash {agent_id, alias, project_id, status, last_seen} with TTL (default 30 min)
- idx:project_agents:{project_id} → Set of agent_ids with active presence (2x TTL for lazy cleanup)

Functions needed:
- update_agent_presence(redis, agent_id, alias, project_id, status='active', ttl_seconds=1800) → timestamp
- get_agent_presence(redis, agent_id) → Optional dict
- list_agent_presences_by_project(redis, project_id) → List of dicts
- list_agent_presences_by_ids(redis, agent_ids) → List of dicts (for enriching agent listings)
- clear_agent_presence(redis, agent_ids) → count deleted

Follow the patterns from beadhub-main's presence.py but strip all workspace/repo/branch-specific code. Keep: URL-encoded key components, lazy stale index cleanup, pipeline batching, 2x TTL on indexes.

Redis is optional in aweb (app.state.redis can be None). All presence functions must handle redis=None gracefully (return empty results).
close_reason: Implemented and tested: GET /v1/agents + presence module. 13 new tests passing.

title: Add POST /v1/agents/heartbeat endpoint
description:
Add a heartbeat endpoint that agents call to report liveness.

POST /v1/agents/heartbeat
- Requires auth (Bearer API key) → resolves project_id and agent_id
- Request body: optional fields (status: str)
- Calls update_agent_presence() from the presence module
- Returns {agent_id, last_seen, ttl_seconds}
- Best-effort: if Redis is unavailable, log warning and return success (SQL is authoritative, presence is a cache)

This is simpler than beadhub's workspace heartbeat — no repo resolution, no immutability checks, no SQL upsert. Just 'I am alive, refresh my TTL.'

Depends on: aweb-gkv.2 (presence module)

title: Enrich GET /v1/agents with online status from presence

After fetching agents from the DB, call list_agent_presences_by_ids() to get presence data. For each agent, set:

- last_seen: ISO timestamp from presence, or null

When Redis is unavailable (app.state.redis is None), online=false and last_seen=null for all agents.

title: aw CLI: call heartbeat on every command
description:
Integrate heartbeat into the aw CLI (aw/cmd/aw/main.go), similar to how bdh calls refreshPresenceHeartbeat() on every command.

On every aw CLI invocation:
1. Load config (API key, base URL)
2. Call client.Heartbeat() in a goroutine (best-effort, non-blocking)
3. Don't fail the command if heartbeat fails (log warning at most)

This ensures that any agent using aw stays visible in presence as long as they're actively running commands.

Depends on: aweb-gkv.5 (aw client Heartbeat method)
